quoteLast: shillings. For lower tastes or leaner purses, there are the Bowery theatres, where melodramas, variety shows, and harlequinades are served up, and the price of admission is but sixpence or a shilling.

quoteFirst: At times, we are happy to learn, he is tolerably composed. The number of persons specially appointed by the doctors is reduced from
quoteLast: , and his principal pages are admitted, and have been for some time, to attend upon him, as when he enjoyed good health. His Majesty dines at half past one o'clock, and, in general, orders his dinners: he invariably has roast beef upon the tables on Sundays. He dresses for dinner, wears his orders, etc.
title: Farmer George, Volume 2
author: Melville, Lewis, 1874-1932

quoteFirst: My acquaintance gets up at twelve. His evenings, from
quoteLast: , he spends at cards or at the piano; he eats and drinks well; other people do all the work for him. He has devised for himself a new pleasure,--smoking. I can remember when he began to smoke.
title: What Shall We Do?
author: Tolstoy, Leo, graf, 1828-1910; Fifield, A. C. (Arthur Charles), 1868-1945 [Editor]; Mayo, Isabella Fyvie, 1843-1914 [Editor]
